{{Infobox station | style= | name=UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ Railway Station | image= | image_size=300 | image_caption= | address= | line= | other= | platform=1 | tracks=4 | electrified= | parking= | bicycle= | passengers= | pass_year= | pass_percent= | opened=1873 | rebuilt= | closed= | ADA= | baggage_check= | code= | owned=[[Turkish State Railways|TCDD]] | zone= | services= | mpassengers= }} The '''UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ Railway Station''' (''UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ GarÄ±'' in [[Turkish language|Turkish]]) is a railway station serving [[UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼]], though situated 3 kilometres north of that town. The station is used by an Ä°stanbul-UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼ service, an UzunkÃ¶prÃ¼-Alpullu service, and the [[Dostluk/Filia Express]], a daily train between [[Istanbul]] and [[Thessaloniki]]. ==History== The station was built in 1873 by the ''[[Chemins de fer Orientaux]]'' on their [[Ä°stanbul]]-[[Vienna]] main line. The world famous [[Orient Express]] stopped at the station on its journey between [[Paris]] and [[Ä°stanbul]]. A [[Turkish State Railways]] organisation was formed after [[World War I]], and in 1937 took over the ''Chemins de fer Orientaux'' as well as the station. ==Rail services using the station== {| class="wikitable" |- !width=110| Previous station!!width=200| [[Turkish State Railways|Service]] !!width=110| Next station |- |
